item.title: Maturity Model
item.description: Author Malcolm Herbert, Red Hat 2016 License Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/ What is a Maturity Model ? A Maturity Model can be used to describe a whole host of technology based environments. Rather than focusing on a specific software product they will look at - technology - process - people For example, a Maturity model can be used to assess current System Management / Data Centre Management and is a useful tool to determine the current position of an organisation, especially in relation to Standard Operating Environment (SOE) and the related areas of Unix to Linux migrations or Continuous Delivery.
